1.text: Hear this, ye priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ear, O house of the king: for this judgment is for you; for ye have been a snare at Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.

2.text: And they have plunged themselves in the corruption of apostasy, but I will be a chastiser of them all.

3.text: I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me; for now, Ephraim, thou hast committed whoredom; Israel is defiled.

4.text: Their doings do not allow them to return unto their God; for the spirit of whoredoms is in the midst of them, and they know not Jehovah.

5.text: And Israelâ€™s pride doth testify to his face; and Israel and Ephraim shall fall by their iniquity: Judah also shall fall with them.

6.text: They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek Jehovah; but they shall not find [him]: he hath withdrawn himself from them.

7.text: They have dealt treacherously against Jehovah; for they have begotten strange children: now shall the new moon devour them, with their allotted possessions.

8.text: Blow the horn in Gibeah, the trumpet in Ramah; cry aloud [at] Beth-aven: behind thee, O Benjamin!

9.text: Ephraim shall be a desolation in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which is sure.

10.text: The princes of Judah are become like them that remove the landmark: I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.

11.text: Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment, because in selfwill he walked after the commandment [of man].

12.text: And I will be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.

13.text: When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his sore, then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb; but he was unable to heal you, nor hath he removed your sore.

14.text: For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah. I, I will tear and go away; I will carry off, and there shall be none to deliver.

15.text: I will go away, I will return to my place, till they acknowledge their trespass, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.
